Shifty numbers are a special set of numbers which have been developed by byteland scientists,these exhibit special properties you can check from the ouput given below.
They are the sum of their own digits and this sum has been shifted in binary by 'n' digits where 'n' is the input decimal number. 


Input
The first line will consist of the total number of test cases T(1<=T<=10). The next T lines will consist of one number on each line. This is the number N(1<=N<=100000000).

Output
For each test case, output a single line which returns the corresponding coded message.


Example
Input:
5 
1
3
5
7
9
Output:
2
24
160
896
4608
